data.title: [Feature Request] Use system SFML and install outside of /opt on linux
data.body:
I don't really see a reason why you guys pull down and build your own SFML if it is already available asa system library. Further, not being able to override the install prefix is super frustrating. /opt is not an acceptable location for a package install.

I would love to package GDevelop for Solus (solus-project.com), but I can't until I am able to build GDevelop into /usr, while using our own SFML library.

data.title: Fix side effects of too broad Windows targeting
data.body: Fixes #266. Details available at that discussion.

data.title: Provide compatibility with Windows high contrast themes
data.body:
By providing a manifest specifying the targeted Windows versions (as per https://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/hh404233(v=vs.85).aspx#_______supporting_high_contrast_themes_in_windows_8_and_later) now scene renders normally under a high contrast theme on Windows, instead of staying unrefreshed.

Fixes #266.

data.title: Layers effects for the JS engine (Pixi.js & Cocos2d-JS)
data.body:
This allows effects ("shaders") to be applied on the layers of a scene.
For now, only one effect is supported (Pixi.js could easily support more, but it's more complicated with Cocos2d-JS) and only a few very specific effects are provided - but more could be created later!

Unrelated to this but also included in this PR: 
- Search dialog now unfold folded events when highlighting a result.
- Editing a layer is now done using the property grid - got rid of the old dialog to edit a layer.

data.title: Multiplayer
data.body: Hello. I have question: have you multiplayer support or not?

data.title: Feature/platformer grab platforms
data.body:
Allow platformer objects to grab and stay on the platform ledges (if both the platform allowing grabbing and the platformer object is allowed to grab platforms).

Will merge this soon if I don't find any problem when using it.

data.title: Editor: Scene won't render under a high contrast theme in Windows
data.body:
Tested only on my machine: ancient ATI Mobility Radeon HD 4650, Windows 10 x64.

With a normal theme it works perfectly. With a high contrast theme, the area in which the scene should be rendered shows nothing; it keeps showing whatever was formerly visible on that screen area.

data.title: Optimizations for the JS game engine
data.body: This avoid creating temporary objects as much as possible.

data.title: [Platformer behaviour] Low value of Acceleration causes jitter
data.body:
A low value of acceleration causes jitter when the platformer character collides with a wall.
Increasing the value to a very hight number reduces the jitter.

Bug report (contains example project):
http://compilgames.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=20&t=7211

Confirmation:
http://compilgames.net/forum/viewtopic.php?f=19&t=7858

data.title: Properties panel always off screen
data.body: I'm on eOS (Ubuntu 14.04) using two monitors and it always appears off the top left of my second monitor (To the left) and the movement bar is off screen. ALT + F7 can't move it

data.title: Named animations
Remove useless SPARK vc2008 libs and demos
data.body:
Prevents a crash when packaging for Fedora and reduce quite a bit the package size !

---

I made a PR just for you to check if these files are really useless (even on Windows).

data.title: Feature/tilemap android
data.body:
This allows the native android games to use the TileMapObject.

**Also contains a fix : GL states were popped even on Android causing some random positioning problems.**

data.title: Feature/improve android export
data.body: This displays a button to export to Android (by allowing Platforms to have multiple exporters) and let the user choose a directory. There's also a help button to redirect the user to the wiki (I'm currently writting the doc)

data.title: Fix box2d.js crash when changing scenes
data.body:
This fix the crash happening when switching scene ~5 times in HTML5 games using box2d.js.

However, the games will still crash after ~20-25 scene changes because of another memory limit. It may be possible to fix this by building box2d.js with empscriptem and the `ALLOW_MEMORY_GROWTH` (but I didn't manage to build box2d.js myself :( )

data.title: Experimental Cocos2d-JS export and native android export
data.body:
This add the (hidden) native android export with SFML (see https://github.com/4ian/GD/pull/246) and support for exporting using Cocos2d-JS (for HTML5 games).

I've been using the Cocos2d export with one of my game and it's working great. I started a page on the wiki to explain how to install Cocos2d and export a game to native platforms: http://wiki.compilgames.net/doku.php/gdevelop/tutorials/howtoexportwithcocos2dx.
Cocos2d could be promoted as the default engine for rendering HTML5 games in preview and exports if it's working great in the future.

data.title: Cross-Platform Code
data.body: I see that it can't cross-compile, but can I take Linux code and compile it in Win GDevelop or would I need to rewrite it? I can't find any information about that specifically.

data.title: Fix crash when ending a scene with Platform objects in it
data.body: The iterator is never invalidated as it is incremented just before its previous iterator is removed from the `std::set`.

data.title: Browser cache preventing scripts from updating in scene preview mode
data.body:
I have a scene with a simple script, seen in the following screenshot:
![gdevelop-eventfail](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17307/13360420/e1ca08de-dcc1-11e5-9c2d-d2d7008201d3.png)

```
// Condition
Circle is being dragged
  Circle distance to circleTarget is below 50 pixels
```

```
// Actions
do =CircleTarget.X(); =CircleTarget.Y() to the position of Circle
do =50 to the opacity of Circle
```

When viewing the scene preview, neither of the actions are triggered. However, everything works as expected when I export the game as HTML.
# Environment
- OS: Ubuntu 15.10
- GD: 4.0.89.0
- Browser: FF 44.0.2

data.title: Enable depth buffer on SFML windows to fix 3DBox objects
data.body: It fixes Box3DObjects on Linux (but not when previewing on Fedora ! :( )

data.title: Not opening on Mac OS X El Capitan
data.body: The Develop.App file does not open. It flashes like it want to open but nothing appears.

data.title: TiledSpriteObject is displayed correctly on Android devices
data.body: (manual repetition using vertices instead of texture repetition)

data.title: Fix Android main.cpp
Fix Extensions headers not included
Fix EventsPrecompiledHeaders.h.pch location on Windows
[Experimental] Native android export
data.body:
I've made some refactoring and made an experimental exporter to see if SFML powered games could be run on Android.
I've made a really quick explanation about it here: http://4ian.github.io/GD-Documentation/GDCpp%20Documentation/d5/dfa/class_android_exporter.html

The result is that simple games are working, with great performances but I've got some graphical glitches with some objects and weird crash from time to time on a larger game. 

I'll probably merge this even if the Android exporter is not working as it's not visible for end users for now and there are some improvements nevertheless.

data.title: Templated objects declarations
data.body:
PR content : 
- `gd::PlatformExtension::AddObject` is now a template method (of argument `T`, the object's class we want to declare). It does not take a function pointer as last argument anymore. The template argument is used to create a lambda that replaces the old `CreateXXXObject(gd::String name)` function pointer
- `ExtensionBase::AddRuntimeObject` is now a templace method (of arguments `T`, the gd::Object derivative, and `U`, the runtime object's class we want to declare). The function pointer argument was removed too as the function pointer is generated by the method itself with a lambda. The lambda is a bit more complicated than the old `CreateXXXRuntimeObject(RuntimeScene&, const gd::Object&)` as, thanks to `T`, it does a `dynamic_cast` on the `gd::Object` before passing it to the runtime object's constructor. This allows the runtime objects constructors to get directly the correctly typed `gd::Object` inherited class (and it handles the `bad_cast` exception).

If you agree with the current implementation, I'll add another commit to update the doc.

data.title: Fix crash when trying to (de)activate a behavior on an object that doesn't have the behavior + bonus
data.body:
Fix #243 by testing if the behavior exists.
Also replaces `std::map<gd::String, Behavior*>` with `std::map<gd::String, std::unique_ptr<Behavior>>` so there is no need to manually delete the behaviors. `GetBehaviorRawPointer` still returns a raw pointer which is non-owning.

I may add another commit to add a templated function to do a deep copy of `std::map<K, std::unique_ptr<T>>` and `std::vector<std::unique_ptr<T>>` (good idea ?).

data.title: Crash when trying to disable a behavior not affected to an object from events
data.body: When you try to disable a behavior on an object that doesn't have the behavior, GDevelop crashes.
